meanings.definition: The job of supervising or taking care of something, such as an organization or property.
meanings.sent1: Her stewardships at the animal shelter involve ensuring the well-being of all the rescued pets.
meanings.sent2: The community trusts him with the stewardships of the park, knowing he will keep it clean and safe.
meanings.sent3: Taking on the stewardships of the school's lost and found, she discovered a sock puppet empire.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the character's stewardships of the enchanted forest symbolize his duty to protect nature.
meanings.sent5: The stewardships of the ancient artifacts were passed down through generations, preserving history.

meanings.definition: The responsible overseeing and protection of something valuable.
meanings.sent1: Their stewardships of the family heirlooms ensured they were passed down intact for generations.
meanings.sent2: The stewardships of the rare species in the sanctuary are crucial for their survival.
meanings.sent3: His stewardships of the cookie jar were so strict, even the crumbs were counted.
meanings.sent4: She viewed her stewardships of the fragile glassware collection as a delicate dance of preservation.
meanings.sent5: The stewardships of the national treasures required constant vigilance to prevent any harm.
